law.catch_line: Uniform school system to be maintained -- Variations.

text.section: A uniform system of common schools shall be maintained in Kentucky.

Local school districts may, with approval of local boards of education, provide special programs and services to one (1) or more areas of the district in contrast to other areas where the variation is a reasonable one based on an attempt to equalize the education progress of the students within the district.

law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 396, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 19, sec. 1, effective June 17, 1978. -- Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 254, sec. 5. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4363-1.
